content: {"id": "fcb98d78-368c-4c6d-bd74-5a1d5adab10b", "name": "New York Common Pantry", "alternate_name": "", "description": "New York Common Pantry reduces hunger and promotes dignity, health and self-sufficiency. NYCP has an array of programs working towards the reduction of hunger and food insecurity. Their whole-person approach starts with food provision through the distribution of nutritious, fresh food pantry packages (Choice Pantry and Mobile Pantry), hearty balanced lunches (Hot Meals and Brown Bag Meals To Go), and supplemental food packages (Nourish). The organization further addresses the reasons for food insecurity with case management services (Help 365), services for unhoused visitors (Project Dignity), and a comprehensive nutrition education program (Live Healthy!). Please visit NYCP's website for all hours of services.
